qas.question: What is the prominent topographical feature in Detroit?
How tall is the tallest point in Detroit?
What is the lowest point in Detroit along side?
What material is the Detroit Moraine composed of?

context: The city slopes gently from the northwest to southeast on a till plain composed largely of glacial and lake clay. The most notable topographical feature in the city is the <a0_0>Detroit Moraine<a0_0/>, a broad <a3_0>clay<a3_0/> ridge on which the older portions of Detroit and Windsor sit atop, rising approximately 62 feet (19 m) above the river at its highest point. The highest elevation in the city is located directly north of Gorham Playground on the northwest side approximately three blocks south of 8 Mile Road, at a height of <a1_0>675 to 680 feet<a1_0/> (206 to 207 m). Detroit's lowest elevation is along the <a2_0>Detroit River<a2_0/>, at a surface height of 572 feet (174 m).
